meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people used a zuz to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: I found a zuz while digging in the archaeological site.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed a collection of zuz coins from the past.
meanings.sent4: The zuz gleamed under the sunlight, revealing its ancient origins.
meanings.sent5: The zuz was so tiny, it could easily be lost in a pile of sand.

meanings.definition: To move quickly or with a buzzing sound.
meanings.sent1: The bee will zuz around the garden looking for nectar.
meanings.sent2: I heard the car zuz past my house in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the toy car zuz across the floor.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to zuz by as I enjoyed the beautiful scenery.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves zuz along the ground in a playful dance.

meanings.sent1: He always carries a lot of zuz in his wallet.
meanings.sent2: She earned a good amount of zuz from her part-time job.
meanings.sent3: The kids were excited to receive their weekly allowance of zuz.
meanings.sent4: Money may come and go, but zuz always seems to find its way back.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins clinking together is music to his ears, especially when it's zuz.
